definition: hegemon/tyrant/lord/feudal chief/to rule by force/to usurp/(in modern advertising) master
to rain/(of rain, snow etc) to fall/to precipitate/to wet
a powerful chief of the princes of the Spring and Autumn Period (770-476 BC)/overlord/hegemon
to contend for hegemony/a power struggle
the Way of the Hegemon/abbr. for 霸王之道/despotic rule/rule by might/evil as opposed to the Way of the King 王道/overbearing/tyranny/(of liquor, medicine etc) strong/potent
lit. to proclaim oneself hegemon/to take a leading role/to build a personal fiefdom
to occupy by force/to seize/to dominate
the task of establishing and maintaining hegemony

sentences.english: Pa takes a job in a small store owned by the railroad.
sentences.chinese: 霸需要由铁路拥有一个小商店的工作。

sentences.english: This is the Ba Jin's development is an important milestone in the history.
sentences.chinese: 这是劲霸公司发展史上的一个重要里程碑。

sentences.english: I even felt like placing hatcheries all over the map because of that.
sentences.chinese: 因为这种感觉，我甚至有欲望去霸全矿。

sentences.english: Big Media, in any event, treated the news as a lecture.
sentences.chinese: 大媒霸把对任何事件的报道都当作是在讲课。

sentences.english: Flying, trampleSimic Sky Swallower can't be the target of spells orabilities.
sentences.chinese: 析米克蔽空霸不能成为咒语或异能的目标。

definition: the most handsome boy in the school (see also 校花[xiao4 hua1])
younger brother/junior male/I (modest word in letter)
"exam master", sb who takes many exams and aces all of them
(coll.) leading light/superstar/badass/(coll.) higher-priced model of Lamborghini
5th earthly branch: 7-9 a.m., 3rd solar month (5th April-4th May), year of the Dragon/ancient Chinese compass point: 120°
the man (or woman) of the moment (idiom)/influential figure
